channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Preposterous Legal Assault Against Fossil Fuels
item.description: The Supreme Court should blow the whistle.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Understood True Freedom Is Inseparable From Duty
item.description: To Charlie Kirk, freedom was never license to do whatever one pleased, it was the space to do what one ought to do.

item.title: Public Health Destroyed Its Own Credibility Long Before RFK Jr. Arrived
item.description: The American medical establishment ignored the science on Covid, abortion, and transgenderism. They have no credibility to criticize RFK Jr.

item.title: Brightline Touches the Third Rail
item.description: Government partnership comes with a high hidden cost.

item.title: Ethan Coen’s Pulped-Fiction Politics
item.description: Honey Don’t! exposes Hollywood’s far-left agenda.

item.title: NJ Gubernatorial Candidate Needs To Tell The Truth About Her Cheating Scandal
item.description: Mikie Sherrill, a Democrat candidate for the New Jersey governorship, refuses to explain her suspicious involvement in a cheating scandal.

item.title: What Thatcher’s Partnership with Reagan Can Teach Us
item.description: Revisiting mutual tributes in the pages of NR, for the centennial of the Iron Lady’s birth.

item.title: Amid The Genocide Of Nigerian Christians, Congress Must Act
item.description: To disregard the eradication of Christianity in Nigeria would embolden jihadists and signal that the blood of the martyrs means nothing to us.

item.title: The Supreme Court Can Choose to Clarify Election Laws in Advance
item.description: Candidates for office should be able to sue in advance to find out when the election is.

item.title: Trump Deserves A Nobel Peace Prize For Securing America’s Border
item.description: Angel parents and families of fentanyl victims urged the Nobel Committee to award the prize to the president for bringing peace at home.

item.title: Arizona attorney general threatens to sue if Speaker Johnson doesn't swear in Rep.-elect Grijalva
item.description: Arizona Attorney General Kris Mayes is threatening to sue House Speaker Mike Johnson if he does not swear in Rep.-elect Adelita Grijalva "without furt...

item.title: Senate vote fails for the eighth time to break Democrats' filibuster of stopgap spending bill
item.description: An eighth failed Senate vote Tuesday on the House-passed stopgap bill to fund the government through Nov. 21 will send the government shutdown into it...

item.title: 'He loved this country': Trump awards Kirk posthumous Medal of Freedom
item.description: A month after he was assassinated while speaking on a Utah college campus, conservative star Charlie Kirk was posthumously awarded the Presidential Me...

item.title: Suspect pleads guilty to April arson targeting Pennsylvania governor
item.description: The man who torched the Pennsylvania governor's mansion while Gov. Josh Shapiro and his family were sleeping inside pleaded guilty Tuesday to the arso...

item.title: Trump says China's boycott of soybeans is an 'economically hostile act'
item.description: President Trump said Tuesday that China's refusal to buy soybeans from U.S. growers is a "hostile act" and he is considering payback, such as a ban on...
